Task Description: Create a scored matrix covering coverage, CDC method, schema drift, private networking, SLAs, pricing, API/DAG integrations.
Client Dependencies: Source system list; security & procurement constraints
Acceptance Criteria: Matrix approved by PDA and Security

Task Title: Spin up PoC via Snowflake Partner Connect
Task Description: Use Partner Connect to create a trial vendor account and auto‑provision Snowflake objects; validate end‑to‑end load.
Design and validate private networking with the vendor; produce enablement steps and validation checks.
Client Dependencies: Cloud & region; Snowflake edition; vendor endpoints

Task Description: Define destination DB/Schema/Warehouse; create service roles/grants with least‑privilege; separate load vs read roles.
Estimate vendor and Snowflake costs; size warehouses for initial and steady‑state CDC; define usage/resource monitors.
Client Dependencies: Volumes, change rates, pricing tier, SLAs

Task Description: Compile table list, confirm PKs and update timestamps; classify by change rate and criticality.

Task Title: Identify RI & dependency groups (from SOURCE catalogs)
Task Description: Extract FK relationships from SOURCE catalogs; build dependency groups to enforce parent‑first orchestration.
Notes: Do NOT rely on Snowflake constraints; replicated targets may not enforce FKs.
Client Dependencies: Read access to SOURCE catalogs; service account

Task Description: Schedule extraction of FK metadata from SOURCE systems; persist to reference tables for reproducible builds.

Task Title: Construct dependency graph from FK rows
Task Description: Transform FK rows into a directed graph; detect cycles/missing PKs; compute topological layers for load ordering.
Acceptance Criteria: Graph validates with no unresolved nodes

Task Description: Infer logical dependencies via naming conventions, index usage, profiling, and SME input; record as logical deps.
Client Dependencies: SME time; sampling access on key tables
Acceptance Criteria: Approved by application owner; used for DAG constraints

Task Description: Decide destination naming (source vs vendor naming), case, and rules for drift (new columns, PK changes).
Create destination DB/Schema(s) and warehouses; configure auto‑suspend/resume and resource monitors.
Acceptance Criteria: Test queries OK; guardrails in place

Task Description: Define vendor system columns + LEIT fields (ingestion_ts, source_system, load_batch_id); document usage.
Client Dependencies: Agreement on metadata model; vendor capabilities

Task Description: Create REF tables to register sources/tables, sync settings, and dependency groups for orchestration.
Create destination user/role and secrets; configure vendor connection using key pair or password.
Acceptance Criteria: Connection test passes in vendor UI

Task Title: Select tables & columns; PKs and CDC options
Task Description: Enable required schemas/tables; confirm PKs; enable deletes capture/soft delete; exclude low‑value objects.
Set frequency to meet freshness SLAs; document schedule/offsets; define daily window if applicable.
Execute historic full load in off‑peak window; monitor resource usage; verify counts.
Enable continuous sync; verify CDC behavior; confirm deletes handling and latency.
Client Dependencies: Stable initial state; vendor CDC configured
Acceptance Criteria: Lag within SLA for 3 consecutive days

Task Description: Implement lag queries vs source timestamps; store metrics and alert on thresholds.
Implement row‑count, PK uniqueness, and null checks on critical columns; schedule validations post‑sync.
Acceptance Criteria: All checks passing or documented exemptions

Task Description: Use vendor API/operator to trigger syncs and sensors to wait for completion; gate downstream dbt/refreshes.

Task Title: Generate DAG constraints from dependency graph
Task Description: Emit edges so parents complete before children; integrate dependency layers/groups.
Align DAG schedules to connector completion; consider offsets and long runs; avoid overlaps.
Document failure modes, re‑sync procedures, schema change handling, and contacts; include vendor support steps.
Deliver walkthrough and handover (dashboards, DQ results, runbook).
Acceptance Criteria: Sign‑off from client PM and data owner

Task Description: Add goverce‑oriented metadata (record_source, business_unit, sensitivity); document lineage impacts.

Task Title: Group objects by transactional integrity (SOURCE FK graph)
Task Description: Persist dependency groupings derived from SOURCE FKs for parent‑first DAG ordering and validation.
Refine enabled table list based on usage and SLAs; exclude low‑value/high‑churn tables; document rationale.
Integrate vendor and Snowflake alerts into client tooling (Slack/PagerDuty/email).
Track warehouse credits and storage; attribute costs to connector; alert on anomalies.
